intro: Pinus teocote f. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited Mexican pine, is a variant of the Mexican pine native to southern Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its elongated, slender cones that produce larger seeds compared to the typical variety. The plant has needle-like leaves that are typically 10–20 cm long, arranged in bundles of five. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
